Trade/Device Name(s): Phoenix Inducible Macrolide Resistance (iMLSb) Test in Staphylococcus species
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System Inducible Macrolide Resistance (iMLSb) Test for detection of resistance in Staphylococcus species
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility by minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria and Gram-positive bacteria, including detection of inducible macrolide-lincosamide-streptogramin B resistance in Staphylococcus species.
